blocks.name: cund
blocks.content: Extend class notation with undefined value function.

blocks.name: diff.cund.s
diff.cund.c
diff.cund.w
df-undef
blocks.content: Define the undefined value function, whose value at set ` s ` is guaranteed not to be a member of ` s ` (see ~ pwuninel ). (Contributed by NM, 15-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: pwuninel2
blocks.content: Direct proof of ~ pwuninel avoiding functions and thus several ZF axioms. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: pwuninel
blocks.content: The power set of the union of a set does not belong to the set. This theorem provides a way of constructing a new set that doesn't belong to a given set. See also ~ pwuninel2 . (Contributed by NM, 27-Jun-2008.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 23-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: undefval
blocks.content: Value of the undefined value function. Normally we will not reference the explicit value but will use ~ undefnel instead. (Contributed by NM, 15-Sep-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm undefval(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(cund, c0), cpw(cuni(c0))))
} = {
  fvmptd3(hs0, cund, c0, cpw(cuni(c0)), universe, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), universe, wcel(c0, c1))
  df-undef(hs0)
  pweqd(cuni(cv(hs0)), cuni(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  elex(c0, c1)
  pwexd(cuni(c0), universe, wcel(c0, c1))
  uniexg(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(cuni(c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
}

}

blocks.name: undefnel2
blocks.content: The undefined value generated from a set is not a member of the set. (Contributed by NM, 15-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: undefnel
blocks.content: The undefined value generated from a set is not a member of the set. (Contributed by NM, 15-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: undefne0
blocks.content: The undefined value generated from a set is not empty. (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-2018.)
